intro: Hartogia capitata, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hartogia capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
